01-01.title: Vienna New Year's Concert
01-01.description: On January 1 each year, the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra performs its famous New Year's Concert at the Musikverein, broadcast to over 90 countries worldwide.

01-01.title: The Beatles' Final Live Performance
01-01.description: The Beatles performed their last live concert on the rooftop of their Apple Corps headquarters in London, famously captured in the 'Let It Be' film.

01-08.title: Elvis Presley's Birthday
01-08.description: January 8, 1935, marks the birth of Elvis Presley, celebrated annually at Graceland with candlelight vigils and musical tributes from fans worldwide.

01-08.title: David Bowie Releases Final Album 'Blackstar'
01-08.description: David Bowie released his final studio album 'Blackstar' just two days before his death, receiving critical acclaim for its artistic depth.

01-15.title: Grammy Award Nominations Announced
01-15.description: In mid-January, the Recording Academy typically announces the nominations for the annual Grammy Awards, music's biggest awards ceremony.

01-22.title: Metallica's Groundbreaking 'One' Video Premieres
01-22.description: Metallica's groundbreaking music video for 'One' premiered on MTV, becoming one of the first heavy metal videos to receive significant rotation on the channel.

01-27.title: Mozart's Birthday
01-27.description: January 27, 1756, marks the birth of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart in Salzburg, Austria, celebrated worldwide with special concerts and performances of his works.

01-27.title: Icons Record 'We Are the World'
01-27.description: Over 40 of America's biggest music icons gathered to record 'We Are the World' to raise funds for African famine relief.

02-01.title: Grammy Awards Ceremony
02-01.description: The Grammy Awards typically take place in early February. On this day in 2009, Robert Plant & Alison Krauss won Album of the Year for 'Raising Sand'.

02-03.title: 'The Day the Music Died'
02-03.description: February 3, 1959, marks 'The Day the Music Died,' when Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. 'The Big Bopper' Richardson died in a plane crash, an event immortalized in Don McLean's 'American Pie'.

02-05.title: Bob Marley's Final Concert
02-05.description: Bob Marley performed his final concert at the Stanley Theater in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, before his death from cancer in 1981.

02-05.title: The Beatles Record 'Please Please Me'
02-05.description: The Beatles recorded their first UK chart-topping single, 'Please Please Me,' at Abbey Road Studios.

02-05.title: Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' Video Premieres on MTV
02-05.description: Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' music video received its first MTV premiere in its full 14-minute version, changing music videos forever.

02-07.title: The Beatles Arrive in America
02-07.description: The Beatles arrived at New York's John F. Kennedy Airport, greeted by thousands of screaming fans, officially launching the 'British Invasion' in the U.S.

02-09.title: The Beatles Debut on The Ed Sullivan Show
02-09.description: The Beatles made their American television debut on The Ed Sullivan Show, performing for an estimated 73 million viewers and igniting the 'British Invasion' in popular music.

02-11.title: Concert for Nelson Mandela's Release
02-11.description: A massive concert was held at Wembley Stadium celebrating Nelson Mandela's release from prison, featuring numerous international music stars.

02-14.title: Whitney Houston's Debut Album Released
02-14.description: Whitney Houston's self-titled debut album was released. It spent 14 weeks at number one on the Billboard 200 and launched one of the best-selling music careers of all time.

02-20.title: Kurt Cobain and Courtney Love Marry
02-20.description: Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain married Hole frontwoman Courtney Love in a small ceremony in Hawaii.

02-24.title: The Rolling Stones' First Regular Gig
02-24.description: The Rolling Stones performed their first show as the resident band at the Crawdaddy Club in Richmond, London, beginning their journey to rock stardom.

02-25.title: Court Rules Harrison Plagiarized 'My Sweet Lord'
02-25.description: A court ruled that George Harrison's hit song 'My Sweet Lord' had unconsciously plagiarized The Chiffons' 1963 song 'He's So Fine'.

02-26.title: Bob Dylan's First Recording Session
02-26.description: Bob Dylan held his first recording session for his self-titled debut album for Columbia Records, marking the beginning of his legendary career.

02-27.title: Michael Jackson Wins a Record 8 Grammys
02-27.description: Michael Jackson won a record eight Grammy Awards in one night for his groundbreaking album 'Thriller'.

03-01.title: The Beatles Record 'Please Please Me' Album in One Day
03-01.description: The Beatles recorded their debut album 'Please Please Me' at Abbey Road Studios, completing the entire album in a single, marathon 13-hour session.

03-03.title: Compact Disc Players Go On Sale in the U.S.
03-03.description: The first compact disc (CD) players went on sale in the United States, revolutionizing how people listened to and purchased music.

03-06.title: Bob Marley's Final Concert in Jamaica
03-06.description: Bob Marley performed his final concert in his homeland of Jamaica at the National Arena in Kingston, two months before his death.

03-09.title: The Beatles Release 'Let It Be' Single
03-09.description: The Beatles released 'Let It Be' as a single in the UK, becoming one of their most enduring and beloved songs.

03-14.title: The Beatles Hold Top 3 Spots on Billboard Hot 100
03-14.description: The Beatles occupied the top three spots on the Billboard Hot 100 chart with 'I Want to Hold Your Hand,' 'She Loves You,' and 'Please Please Me'.

03-16.title: The Beatles' Film 'Help!' Premieres
03-16.description: The Beatles' second film 'Help!' premiered in London, featuring a soundtrack that included classic songs like 'Ticket to Ride' and 'Yesterday'.

03-20.title: Spring Music Festival Season Begins
03-20.description: Around the spring equinox, many major music festivals begin their seasons, including the iconic South by Southwest (SXSW) in Austin, Texas.

03-22.title: The Beatles Release 'With the Beatles'
03-22.description: The Beatles released their second UK album 'With the Beatles,' which spent 21 weeks at number one on the charts.

03-25.title: Elton John Releases 'Candle in the Wind 1997'
03-25.description: Elton John released his tribute to Princess Diana, 'Candle in the Wind 1997,' which would go on to become the best-selling single of all time.

03-26.title: Diana Ross's Final Concert with The Supremes
03-26.description: Diana Ross performed her final concert with The Supremes at the Frontier Hotel in Las Vegas before embarking on her solo career.

03-28.title: Live Aid Concerts Announced
03-28.description: Bob Geldof and Midge Ure announced plans for the Live Aid concerts, which would become one of the largest-scale television broadcasts and charity events in history.

03-30.title: Paul McCartney Announces He's Leaving The Beatles
03-30.description: Paul McCartney announced he was leaving The Beatles, effectively confirming the breakup of the legendary band.

03-31.title: Eurovision National Selections Conclude
03-31.description: Late March often marks the conclusion of many national selection competitions for the Eurovision Song Contest, where countries choose their representatives for the main event in May.

04-01.title: Bob Dylan Receives Nobel Prize
04-01.description: Bob Dylan receives his Nobel Prize for Literature at a private ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden.

04-02.title: Fleetwood Mac's 'Rumours' Hits No. 1
04-02.description: Fleetwood Mac's iconic album 'Rumours' goes to No. 1 on the charts, where it would remain for 31 weeks.

04-03.title: Elvis Presley Records Three Classics
04-03.description: Elvis Presley records ‘It's Now Or Never’, ‘Fever’, and ‘Are You Lonesome Tonight’ at RCA studios in Nashville, Tennessee.

04-04.title: Sondheim's 'Follies' Opens on Broadway
04-04.description: Stephen Sondheim's musical 'Follies' opens at the Winter Garden Theater in NYC. At the time, it was the most expensive Broadway musical ever produced.

04-05.title: Strauss's 'Die Fledermaus' Premieres
04-05.description: Johann Strauss Jr's famous operetta 'Die Fledermaus' premieres in Vienna, Austria.

04-06.title: ABBA Wins Eurovision with 'Waterloo'
04-06.description: At the 19th Eurovision Song Contest, the Swedish group ABBA wins with their performance of 'Waterloo,' launching their international career.

04-07.title: Bach's 'St John Passion' Premieres
04-07.description: Johann Sebastian Bach's 'St John Passion' premieres on Good Friday at St. Nicholas Church in Leipzig, Germany.

04-08.title: Ponchielli's Opera 'La Gioconda' Premieres
04-08.description: Amilcare Ponchielli's opera 'La Gioconda' premieres in Milan, Italy.

04-09.title: 'The Lion King' Becomes Broadway's Highest-Grossing Show
04-09.description: 'The Lion King' becomes the highest-grossing Broadway show of all time, overtaking 'The Phantom of the Opera'.

04-10.title: Paul McCartney Announces Breakup of The Beatles
04-10.description: Paul McCartney officially announces the breakup of The Beatles in a press release for his debut solo album.

04-12.title: Bill Haley Records 'Rock Around the Clock'
04-12.description: Bill Haley & His Comets record 'Rock Around the Clock,' a song that would become an anthem of rebellion and one of the most important in rock and roll history.

04-13.title: Handel's 'Messiah' Premieres
04-13.description: George Frideric Handel's oratorio 'Messiah' is performed for the first time at the New Music Hall in Dublin, Ireland.

04-14.title: Metallica Sues Napster
04-14.description: Metallica files a lawsuit against the peer-to-peer file-sharing platform Napster, sparking a major movement against digital music piracy.

04-15.title: Bach's 'St Matthew Passion' Premieres
04-15.description: Johann Sebastian Bach's 'St Matthew Passion' premieres at the Thomaskirche in Leipzig, Germany.

04-16.title: Meyerbeer's 'Le prophète' Premieres
04-16.description: Giacomo Meyerbeer's grand opera 'Le prophète' premieres in Paris.

04-17.title: Paul McCartney Releases First Solo Album
04-17.description: Paul McCartney releases his first solo album, 'McCartney', just one week after announcing the breakup of The Beatles.

04-18.title: Wham! Becomes First Western Pop Act to Release Album in China
04-18.description: The British pop duo Wham! becomes the first Western popular music act to release an album in the People's Republic of China.

04-19.title: Johnny Cash Releases 'Ring of Fire'
04-19.description: Johnny Cash releases the single 'Ring of Fire,' written by his future wife June Carter and Merle Kilgore. It would become one of his signature songs.

04-20.title: Sousa's 'El Capitan' Premieres on Broadway
04-20.description: John Philip Sousa's operetta 'El Capitan' premieres on Broadway at the Broadway Theatre in NYC.

04-21.title: Elvis Presley's First Hit Reaches #1
04-21.description: Elvis Presley's first hit record, 'Heartbreak Hotel,' reaches #1 on the Billboard charts.

04-22.title: Tchaikovsky Completes 'Swan Lake'
04-22.description: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky completes the score for his ballet 'Swan Lake'.

04-23.title: Judy Garland's Legendary Carnegie Hall Concert
04-23.description: Singer Judy Garland appears in concert at Carnegie Hall in NYC. The live recording of the event wins the Grammy Award for Album of the Year, the first by a female artist.

04-24.title: Streaming Overtakes Physical Music Sales
04-24.description: According to the IFPI, streaming music services overtake worldwide sales of CDs and vinyl for the first time in history.

04-25.title: Puccini's 'Turandot' Premieres
04-25.description: Giacomo Puccini's final opera, 'Turandot,' premieres in Milan, Italy, two years after the composer's death.

04-26.title: Charles Ives' 4th Symphony Premieres
04-26.description: Charles Ives' complex 4th Symphony premieres at Carnegie Hall in New York, 11 years after the composer's death.

04-27.title: Beethoven Composes 'Für Elise'
04-27.description: Ludwig van Beethoven composes his famous piano piece 'Für Elise,' one of the most recognized melodies in classical music.

04-28.title: Glenn Miller Records 'Pennsylvania 6-5000'
04-28.description: Glenn Miller and his orchestra record the song 'Pennsylvania 6-5000' in NYC. The tune is named after the phone number of the Hotel Pennsylvania in Manhattan.

04-29.title: Aretha Franklin Releases 'Respect'
04-29.description: Aretha Franklin releases her cover of Otis Redding's 'Respect,' turning it into an iconic anthem for the feminist and civil rights movements. It was named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1967.

04-30.title: Debussy's Opera 'Pelléas et Mélisande' Premieres
04-30.description: Claude Debussy's only completed opera, 'Pelléas et Mélisande,' premieres in Paris.

05-01.title: Mozart's 'The Marriage of Figaro' Premieres
05-01.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's opera 'The Marriage of Figaro' premieres in Vienna, with Mozart himself conducting.

05-02.title: Prokofiev's 'Peter and the Wolf' Premieres
05-02.description: Sergei Prokofiev's symphonic fairy tale 'Peter and the Wolf' premieres in Moscow.

05-03.title: Longest-Running Musical 'The Fantasticks' Opens
05-03.description: The musical 'The Fantasticks' opens in Greenwich Village, NYC, and goes on to become the longest-running musical in history.

05-03.title: Lady Gaga Holds Largest Concert for a Female Artist
05-03.description: Lady Gaga's free concert at Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, draws an estimated crowd of 2.5 million, the largest concert in history for a female artist.

05-04.title: First Grammy Awards Ceremony
05-04.description: The first-ever Grammy Awards ceremony is held, with Perry Como ('Catch a Falling Star') and Ella Fitzgerald ('Ella Fitzgerald Sings the Duke Ellington Songbook') winning major awards.

05-05.title: Carnegie Hall Opens in New York City
05-05.description: The Music Hall (now Carnegie Hall) opens in New York City, with Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky as a guest conductor.

05-06.title: Rolling Stones Release 'Paint It Black'
05-06.description: The Rolling Stones release the single 'Paint It Black' in the US, notable for Brian Jones' prominent use of the sitar.

05-07.title: Beethoven's 9th Symphony Premieres
05-07.description: Ludwig van Beethoven's 9th (Choral) Symphony, featuring the 'Ode to Joy' and often regarded as his greatest work, premieres in Vienna, Austria.

05-08.title: The Cure Release Debut Album
05-08.description: The Cure release their debut album 'Three Imaginary Boys' in the UK.

05-09.title: The Beatles Sign with EMI Parlophone
05-09.description: The Beatles sign their first recording contract with EMI's Parlophone label, with George Martin as their producer.

05-09.title: 'Here Comes the Sun' Reaches One Billion Spotify Streams
05-09.description: George Harrison's 'Here Comes the Sun' becomes the first Beatles song to register one billion streams on Spotify, and also the oldest song to achieve the milestone.

05-10.title: Rolling Stones Signed on George Harrison's Advice
05-10.description: Decca Records signs The Rolling Stones, reportedly on the advice of Beatles guitarist George Harrison.

05-11.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'Cats' Premieres
05-11.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical 'Cats,' based on poetry by T. S. Eliot, opens in London's West End and runs for a record-breaking 8,949 performances.

05-12.title: Jimi Hendrix Experience Releases 'Are You Experienced'
05-12.description: The Jimi Hendrix Experience releases 'Are You Experienced,' one of the most influential debut albums in rock history.

05-13.title: Mozart's First Opera Premieres
05-13.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's first opera, 'Apollo et Hyacinthus,' written when he was just 11 years old, premieres in Salzburg.

05-14.title: Mendelssohn's 'Hebrides' Overture Premieres
05-14.description: Felix Mendelssohn's concert overture 'The Hebrides' (also known as 'Fingal's Cave') premieres in London.

05-15.title: Rabaud's Opera 'Mârouf' Premieres
05-15.description: Henri Rabaud's opera 'Mârouf, savetier du Caire' (Marouf, the Cairo Cobbler) premieres in Paris.

05-17.title: Twenty One Pilots Release 'Blurryface'
05-17.description: 'Blurryface,' the fourth studio album by Twenty One Pilots, is released. It becomes the first album in history to have every track certified gold or higher.

05-18.title: Backstreet Boys Release 'Millennium'
05-18.description: 'Millennium,' the third studio album by the Backstreet Boys, is released. It becomes one of the best-selling albums of all time, with over 30 million copies sold.

05-19.title: 'South Pacific' Soundtrack Hits #1
05-19.description: The soundtrack album for Rodgers and Hammerstein's 'South Pacific' goes to #1, where it stays for an incredible 31 weeks.

05-20.title: The Police Release 'Every Breath You Take'
05-20.description: The Police release their single 'Every Breath You Take,' which would go on to be named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1983.

05-21.title: Bob Marley Receives State Funeral
05-21.description: Reggae superstar Bob Marley receives a Jamaican state funeral following his death from cancer at age 36.

05-22.title: Pneumatic Piano Player Patented
05-22.description: American inventor Edwin S. Votey receives a patent for the pneumatic piano player, or pianola.

05-23.title: Eminem Releases 'The Marshall Mathers LP'
05-23.description: Eminem releases his third studio album, 'The Marshall Mathers LP.' It became the fastest-selling studio album by any solo artist in American music history.

05-24.title: First Eurovision Song Contest
05-24.description: The first Eurovision Song Contest is held in Lugano, Switzerland, with Lys Assia of Switzerland winning with the song 'Refrain'.

05-25.title: Gilbert & Sullivan's 'H.M.S. Pinafore' Premieres
05-25.description: W. S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's comic opera 'H.M.S. Pinafore' premieres in London, becoming their first major international success.

05-26.title: The Beatles Release 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'
05-26.description: The Beatles' landmark album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' is released in the UK. It goes to #1 for 22 weeks in the UK and 15 weeks in the US.

05-27.title: Sex Pistols Release 'God Save the Queen'
05-27.description: The Sex Pistols release their punk anthem 'God Save the Queen,' sparking major controversy and leading to a ban by the BBC.

05-27.title: BTS Becomes First K-Pop Group to Top U.S. Billboard 200
05-27.description: South Korean boy band BTS becomes the first K-pop group to top the U.S. Billboard 200 chart with their album 'Love Yourself: Tear'.

05-28.title: Slash First Hears Axl Rose Sing
05-28.description: Future Guns N' Roses guitarist Slash first hears Axl Rose singing with the band Rapidfire at a club on the Sunset Strip in Los Angeles.

05-29.title: Bing Crosby Records 'White Christmas'
05-29.description: Bing Crosby records Irving Berlin's song 'White Christmas.' It becomes the world's best-selling single, with an estimated 100 million copies sold.

05-30.title: Original Dixieland Jazz Band Records Jazz Standard
05-30.description: The jazz standard 'Darktown Strutters' Ball' by Shelton Brooks is recorded by the Original Dixieland Jazz Band.

05-31.title: Rihanna Releases Breakthrough Album 'Good Girl Gone Bad'
05-31.description: Rihanna releases her breakthrough album 'Good Girl Gone Bad,' featuring hit singles like 'Umbrella' and 'Don't Stop the Music'.

06-01.title: Simon & Garfunkel's 'Mrs. Robinson' Hits #1
06-01.description: Simon & Garfunkel's single 'Mrs. Robinson' from the film 'The Graduate' hits #1. It was the first rock song to win a Grammy for Record of the Year.

06-02.title: Ray Charles' 'I Can't Stop Loving You' Hits #1
06-02.description: Ray Charles' cover of Don Gibson's 'I Can't Stop Loving You,' from his influential crossover album 'Modern Sounds in Country and Western Music,' hits #1 on the Billboard charts.

06-03.title: Queen's 'Bohemian Rhapsody' Goes Gold
06-03.description: Queen's operatic rock masterpiece 'Bohemian Rhapsody' is certified gold for selling over one million units.

06-04.title: Bruce Springsteen Releases 'Born in the USA'
06-04.description: Bruce Springsteen releases his seventh studio album, 'Born in the USA.' It becomes his biggest commercial success, selling over 30 million copies worldwide.

06-05.title: Britten's Opera 'Peter Grimes' Premieres
06-05.description: Benjamin Britten's opera 'Peter Grimes' premieres in London, marking a new era for English opera.

06-06.title: Randy Travis Releases Debut Album 'Storms of Life'
06-06.description: Randy Travis releases his debut album 'Storms of Life,' which becomes a landmark of the new traditionalist country movement and is named Billboard's Album of the Year for 1987.

06-07.title: Musical 'Grease' Opens on Broadway
06-07.description: The musical 'Grease' opens at the Broadhurst Theatre in NYC, eventually running for 3,388 performances.

06-08.title: RuPaul Releases Debut Album 'Supermodel of the World'
06-08.description: Drag queen RuPaul releases his debut album 'Supermodel of the World,' featuring the hit single 'Supermodel (You Better Work)'.

06-09.title: Jelly Roll Morton Records 'Jelly-Roll Blues'
06-09.description: 'Jelly-Roll Blues' is recorded by American jazz pioneer, pianist, and composer Jelly Roll Morton.

06-10.title: Wagner's 'Tristan und Isolde' Premieres
06-10.description: Richard Wagner's influential opera 'Tristan und Isolde' premieres in Munich, Germany.

06-11.title: Universal Music Master Tapes Lost in Fire
06-11.description: The New York Times reports that an estimated 500,000 master recordings, including works by Chuck Berry, Louis Armstrong, and Ella Fitzgerald, were lost in a 2008 warehouse fire.

06-12.title: Mariah Carey's Debut Album is Released
06-12.description: Mariah Carey's self-titled debut album is released, which would go on to produce four #1 singles.

06-13.title: Björk Releases Acclaimed Album 'Post'
06-13.description: Icelandic artist Björk releases her critically acclaimed second solo album, 'Post'.

06-14.title: First Country Music Hit Recorded
06-14.description: The first country music hit, 'Little Old Log Cabin in the Lane' by Fiddlin' John Carson, is recorded.

06-15.title: Bob Dylan Records 'Like a Rolling Stone'
06-15.description: Bob Dylan records the single 'Like a Rolling Stone,' a song that revolutionized pop music and was later named #1 on Rolling Stone magazine's '500 Greatest Songs of All Time'.

06-16.title: 'The Wizard of Oz' Musical Opens in Chicago
06-16.description: 'The Wizard of Oz' musical first opens in Chicago, Illinois, years before the famous 1939 film.

06-16.title: David Bowie Releases 'Ziggy Stardust'
06-16.description: David Bowie releases his fifth studio album, 'The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars,' considered his artistic breakthrough and a landmark in glam rock.

06-17.title: Carole King's 'Tapestry' Hits #1
06-17.description: Carole King's seminal album 'Tapestry' goes to #1 on the U.S. album charts, where it stays for 15 consecutive weeks.

06-18.title: Bryan Adams Releases '(Everything I Do) I Do It for You'
06-18.description: Bryan Adams releases the single '(Everything I Do) I Do It for You,' which would become Billboard's Song of the Year for 1991.

06-19.title: Loretta Lynn Records 'I'm a Honky Tonk Girl'
06-19.description: Country music legend Loretta Lynn records her debut single, 'I'm a Honky Tonk Girl'.

06-20.title: Newport '69 Becomes Largest Pop Concert
06-20.description: Approximately 200,000 people attend Newport '69 in California, the largest-ever pop concert at the time. Jimi Hendrix was paid a record $120,000 to perform.

06-21.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'Evita' Premieres
06-21.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's musical 'Evita,' starring Elaine Paige, premieres in London.

06-22.title: Stevie Wonder Releases First Single 'Fingertips'
06-22.description: A 13-year-old 'Little' Stevie Wonder releases his first single, 'Fingertips.' It became the first live, non-studio recording to go to #1 on the Billboard charts.

06-23.title: Supertramp's 'Breakfast in America' Hits #1
06-23.description: Supertramp's 'Breakfast in America,' featuring the hit 'Take the Long Way Home,' becomes the #1 album in the US.

06-23.title: Britney Spears Speaks Out Against Conservatorship
06-23.description: Britney Spears makes a public plea to a judge to end her court-ordered conservatorship, stating, 'I think this conservatorship is abusive. I don't think I can live a full life.'

06-24.title: First Performance of 'O Canada'
06-24.description: The first public performance of 'O Canada,' the song that would become the national anthem of Canada, takes place.

06-25.title: Prince Releases 'Purple Rain'
06-25.description: Prince releases his sixth studio album and film soundtrack, 'Purple Rain.' It sells over 25 million copies and wins two Grammy Awards and an Academy Award.

06-26.title: Wagner's 'Die Walküre' Premieres
06-26.description: Richard Wagner's opera 'Die Walküre' (The Valkyrie), the second part of his Ring Cycle and featuring the famous 'Ride of the Valkyries,' premieres in Munich.

06-27.title: Aerosmith Offers First Free Song Download by a Major Band
06-27.description: Aerosmith becomes the first major band to allow fans to download a full new track, 'Head First,' for free from the internet.

06-28.title: Louis Armstrong Records 'West End Blues'
06-28.description: Louis Armstrong makes a landmark 78 rpm recording of 'West End Blues,' considered one of the most influential recordings in jazz history.

06-29.title: First Known Recording of Classical Music
06-29.description: The first known recording of classical music is made: Handel's 'Israel in Egypt,' captured on a wax cylinder.

06-30.title: Boyz II Men Release 'End of the Road'
06-30.description: 'End of the Road,' a single by Boyz II Men, is released. It won two Grammy Awards and was named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1992.

07-01.title: 'Sgt. Pepper' Hits #1 in the U.S.
07-01.description: The Beatles' album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' goes to #1 in the United States, where it stays for 15 weeks.

07-02.title: Live 8 Concerts Raise Poverty Awareness
07-02.description: Live 8 concerts, organized by Bob Geldof, are held simultaneously around the world to raise awareness of global poverty and pressure G8 leaders.

07-03.title: Cardi B Becomes First Female Rapper with Two #1 Hits
07-03.description: Cardi B becomes the first female rapper to achieve two #1 hits on the US Billboard chart with her song 'I Like It'.

07-04.title: First Public Performance of 'America (My Country 'Tis of Thee)'
07-04.description: The patriotic song 'America (My Country 'Tis of Thee),' with lyrics by Samuel Francis Smith, has its first public performance at a church in Boston, Massachusetts.

07-05.title: Pink Floyd Debuts 'Wish You Were Here' with Exploding Plane
07-05.description: At the Knebworth Festival in England, Pink Floyd debuts their album 'Wish You Were Here' with elaborate pyrotechnics, including an exploding model plane that 'crashes' into the stage.

07-06.title: John Lennon Meets Paul McCartney
07-06.description: A 16-year-old John Lennon and a 15-year-old Paul McCartney meet for the first time when Lennon's band, the Quarrymen, perform at a church fête in Liverpool.

07-07.title: First 'Three Tenors' Concert
07-07.description: The first 'Three Tenors' concert, featuring Plácido Domingo, José Carreras, and Luciano Pavarotti, is held in Rome. The recording becomes the world's best-selling classical album.

07-08.title: Spice Girls Release Debut Single 'Wannabe'
07-08.description: The British girl group the Spice Girls release their debut single 'Wannabe' in the UK, a song that would launch them into global stardom.

07-09.title: 'Rock Around the Clock' Hits #1
07-09.description: Bill Haley & His Comets' rock and roll anthem 'Rock Around the Clock' tops the Billboard chart, becoming one of the best-selling singles ever.

07-10.title: Drake Breaks Beatles' Billboard Record
07-10.description: Drake surpasses The Beatles' long-held record for the most simultaneous singles in the Billboard Hot 100's top 10, with seven tracks from his album 'Scorpion'.

07-11.title: David Bowie Releases 'Space Oddity'
07-11.description: David Bowie releases the single 'Space Oddity' nine days before the Apollo 11 moon landing, perfectly capturing the zeitgeist of the space race.

07-12.title: The Rolling Stones' First Performance
07-12.description: The Rolling Stones give their first-ever performance at the Marquee Club in London.

07-13.title: Elvis Presley Releases 'Hound Dog / Don't Be Cruel'
07-13.description: Elvis Presley releases the double A-sided single 'Hound Dog' and 'Don't Be Cruel,' which would become one of the best-selling singles of all time.

07-13.title: Live Aid Concerts Raise Millions for Famine Relief
07-13.description: The Live Aid benefit concerts, held at both Wembley Stadium in London and JFK Stadium in Philadelphia, raise over $70 million for African famine relief.

07-14.title: 'La Marseillaise' Becomes French National Anthem
07-14.description: The French National Convention decrees 'La Marseillaise' as France's official national anthem.

07-15.title: Elton John's First #1 U.S. Album
07-15.description: 'Honky Chateau' becomes Elton John's first #1 album in the US, and includes the hit single 'Rocket Man'.

07-16.title: Mozart's 'The Abduction from the Seraglio' Premieres
07-16.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's opera 'Die Entführung aus dem Serail' (The Abduction from the Seraglio) premieres in Vienna with Mozart conducting.

07-17.title: Handel's 'Water Music' Premieres on the Thames
07-17.description: George Frideric Handel's 'Water Music' suite premieres on a barge cruising the River Thames in London for King George I.

07-18.title: Billy Joel's 'Glass Houses' Tops Charts
07-18.description: Billy Joel's album 'Glass Houses,' featuring the #1 hit 'It's Still Rock and Roll to Me,' tops the U.S. charts.

07-19.title: Billboard Publishes Its First Music Chart
07-19.description: Billboard magazine publishes its earliest known music chart, 'Last Week's 10 Best Sellers Among Popular Songs.' The #1 song was 'Malinda's Wedding Day'.

07-20.title: Bob Dylan Releases 'Like a Rolling Stone'
07-20.description: Columbia Records releases Bob Dylan's single 'Like a Rolling Stone,' a groundbreaking track that redefined popular music.

07-21.title: Roger Waters Performs 'The Wall' at the Berlin Wall
07-21.description: Pink Floyd's Roger Waters leads a star-studded charity performance of 'The Wall' on the site where the Berlin Wall once stood.

07-22.title: First Black Female Opera Singer Performs in U.S.
07-22.description: Caterina Jarboro sings the title role in 'Aida' at the New York Hippodrome, becoming the first Black female opera singer to perform with a major company in the United States.

07-23.title: Frank Sinatra's 'Strangers in the Night' Hits #1
07-23.description: Frank Sinatra's album 'Strangers in the Night' hits #1 on the US charts. The title track would win a Grammy for Record of the Year.

07-24.title: Survivor's 'Eye of the Tiger' Reaches #1
07-24.description: The single 'Eye of the Tiger' by Survivor, from the 'Rocky III' soundtrack, begins a 6-week run at #1 on the U.S. charts.

07-24.title: Joni Mitchell's Surprise Return to the Stage
07-24.description: Singer-songwriter icon Joni Mitchell makes a surprise appearance at the Newport Folk Festival, her first full public performance in nearly 20 years.

07-25.title: Bob Dylan 'Goes Electric' at Newport Folk Festival
07-25.description: Bob Dylan is famously booed by some members of the crowd at the Newport Folk Festival for performing with an electric guitar, a pivotal moment in the creation of folk rock.

07-25.title: 'A Chorus Line' Opens on Broadway
07-25.description: The musical 'A Chorus Line' opens at the Shubert Theatre in NYC, setting a record for the longest-running Broadway show at the time and winning 10 Tony Awards.

07-26.title: Wagner's Opera 'Parsifal' Premieres
07-26.description: Richard Wagner's final opera, 'Parsifal,' premieres in Bayreuth, Germany.

07-27.title: Billboard Publishes First Singles Chart
07-27.description: Billboard magazine publishes its first official singles record chart. 'I'll Never Smile Again' by Tommy Dorsey, with vocals by Frank Sinatra, is ranked #1.

07-27.title: 'Little Shop of Horrors' Opens Off-Broadway
07-27.description: The musical 'Little Shop of Horrors,' by Alan Menken and Howard Ashman, opens Off-Broadway at the Orpheum Theatre in NYC.

07-28.title: Foxtrot Dance First Performed
07-28.description: The Foxtrot is first danced at the New Amsterdam Roof Garden in New York City by its creator, Harry Fox.

07-28.title: 'Summer Jam' at Watkins Glen
07-28.description: An estimated 600,000 people attend the 'Summer Jam' rock festival featuring The Grateful Dead, The Band, and The Allman Brothers Band at Watkins Glen, New York, the largest pop festival audience at the time.

07-29.title: Led Zeppelin Robbed in New York
07-29.description: While on tour, Led Zeppelin has over $200,000 in cash stolen from a safe deposit box at their New York hotel.

07-30.title: Elvis Presley Joins Musicians' Union
07-30.description: Early in his career, Elvis Presley joins the Memphis Federation of Musicians, Local 71.

07-31.title: Cliff Richard Gets First #1 Single
07-31.description: Cliff Richard and the Shadows have their first British #1 single with 'Living Doll,' the best-selling British single of 1959.

08-02.title: The Beatles' First Cavern Club Gig as House Band
08-02.description: The Beatles perform their first gig as the resident house band at Liverpool's legendary Cavern Club.

08-03.title: Camila Cabello Releases 'Havana'
08-03.description: Camila Cabello releases her single 'Havana.' It would become the best-selling digital single worldwide in 2018, with 19 million copies sold.

08-04.title: Billboard Hot 100 is Published for First Time
08-04.description: The Billboard Hot 100 chart is published for the first time, with 'Poor Little Fool' by Ricky Nelson at #1.

08-05.title: The Beatles Release 'Yellow Submarine / Eleanor Rigby'
08-05.description: The Beatles release the double A-sided single 'Yellow Submarine' and 'Eleanor Rigby' in the UK.

08-06.title: The Ramones' Final Performance
08-06.description: The American punk rock band The Ramones performs for the last time at The Palace in Hollywood, California, as part of the Lollapalooza festival.

08-07.title: Kesha Releases 'Tik Tok'
08-07.description: The single 'Tik Tok' is released by Kesha. It would be named Billboard's Song of the Year for 2010.

08-08.title: Metallica's James Hetfield Injured by Onstage Pyrotechnics
08-08.description: Metallica singer and guitarist James Hetfield suffers second and third-degree burns after an on-stage pyrotechnics explosion during a concert in Montreal.

08-09.title: Tim McGraw Releases 'Just to See You Smile'
08-09.description: 'Just to See You Smile,' a single by Tim McGraw, is released. It would be named Billboard's Country Song of the Year for 1998.

08-10.title: Mozart Completes 'Eine kleine Nachtmusik'
08-10.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his famous chamber piece 'Eine kleine Nachtmusik' (A Little Serenade).

08-11.title: Chic Releases 'C'est Chic'
08-11.description: The second studio album by Chic, 'C'est Chic,' is released, featuring the iconic single 'Le Freak'.

08-12.title: Metallica Releases 'The Black Album'
08-12.description: Heavy metal band Metallica releases its fifth album, 'Metallica' (commonly known as 'The Black Album'), which debuts at #1 on the Billboard 200 chart.

08-13.title: Luke Bryan Releases 'Crash My Party'
08-13.description: 'Crash My Party,' the fourth studio album by country star Luke Bryan, is released. It was named Billboard's Album of the Year for 2014.

08-14.title: 'Battle of Britpop': Oasis vs. Blur
08-14.description: In the highly publicized 'Battle of Britpop,' rival bands Oasis ('Roll with It') and Blur ('Country House') release their new singles on the same day.

08-15.title: Woodstock Music and Art Fair Opens
08-15.description: The legendary Woodstock Festival opens in Bethel, New York, on Max Yasgur's dairy farm. Day one performers include Richie Havens, Ravi Shankar, Arlo Guthrie, and Joan Baez.

08-16.title: The Ramones Debut at CBGB
08-16.description: The American punk rock band The Ramones make their concert debut at the iconic CBGB club in New York City.

08-17.title: Wagner's 'Götterdämmerung' Premieres
08-17.description: Richard Wagner's opera 'Götterdämmerung' (Twilight of the Gods), the final part of his Ring Cycle, premieres in Bayreuth.

08-18.title: Elvis's 'Hound Dog / Don't Be Cruel' Reaches #1
08-18.description: Elvis Presley's double A-sided single 'Hound Dog' and 'Don't Be Cruel' reaches #1 on the charts, staying there for a record 11 weeks.

08-19.title: Lady Gaga Releases Debut Album 'The Fame'
08-19.description: Lady Gaga releases her debut album, 'The Fame,' which would go on to win the Grammy for Best Electronic/Dance Album in 2010.

08-20.title: Tchaikovsky's '1812 Overture' Debuts
08-20.description: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky's '1812 Overture,' famous for its cannon fire finale, debuts in Moscow.

08-21.title: Nickelback Releases 'How You Remind Me'
08-21.description: The single 'How You Remind Me' by Nickelback is released. It would be named Billboard's Song of the Year for 2002.

08-22.title: Madonna's 'Who's That Girl' Hits #1
08-22.description: Madonna's single 'Who's That Girl,' from the film of the same name, hits #1 on the Billboard Hot 100.

08-23.title: Jeff Buckley Releases 'Grace'
08-23.description: Jeff Buckley releases his only studio album, 'Grace,' which features his iconic cover of Leonard Cohen's 'Hallelujah'.

08-24.title: Mozart Completes Violin and Piano Sonata K.526
08-24.description: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart completes his sonata for violin and piano in A major, K.526.

08-25.title: Lauryn Hill Releases 'The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill'
08-25.description: Lauryn Hill releases her debut solo album, 'The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill.' It won 5 Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year.

08-26.title: The Beatles Release 'Hey Jude' in the U.S.
08-26.description: The single 'Hey Jude' is released by The Beatles in the US. It would be named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1968.

08-27.title: The Beatles Meet Elvis Presley
08-27.description: The Beatles spend an evening with their idol, Elvis Presley, at his home in Los Angeles, California.

08-28.title: Bob Dylan Booed for Playing Electric Guitar
08-28.description: Bob Dylan is booed for playing an electric set during a concert at Forest Hills Tennis Stadium in Queens, New York, just a month after his controversial Newport performance.

08-29.title: Cliff Richard Releases First British Rock 'n' Roll Song
08-29.description: Cliff Richard and The Drifters (later The Shadows) release their debut single 'Move It,' widely credited as the first authentic British rock and roll song.

08-30.title: The Beatles Release 'Hey Jude' in the UK
08-30.description: The Beatles release the single 'Hey Jude' in the UK, their first record on their own Apple label.

08-31.title: The Chicks Release 'Fly'
08-31.description: 'Fly,' the fifth studio album by The Chicks (then known as the Dixie Chicks), is released. It won the Grammy for Best Country Album.

09-01.title: Mozart Publishes String Quartets
09-01.description: Mozart publishes his set of six string quartets dedicated to Haydn (the 'Haydn Quartets') in Vienna.

09-02.title: Rod Stewart's First #1 UK Hit
09-02.description: Rod Stewart achieves his first #1 hit single in the UK with 'You Wear It Well'.

09-03.title: Schoenberg's 'Five Pieces for Orchestra' Premieres
09-03.description: Arnold Schoenberg's atonal work 'Fünf Orchesterstücke' (Five Pieces for Orchestra) premieres in London.

09-04.title: The Beatles' 'Help!' Hits #1
09-04.description: The Beatles' single 'Help!' goes to #1 on the charts, where it stays for three weeks.

09-05.title: Performance of John Cage's 639-Year-Long Piece Begins
09-05.description: The performance of John Cage's musical composition 'As Slow as Possible,' intended to be played for 639 years, begins at St. Burchardi Church in Halberstadt, Germany.

09-06.title: Mozart's 'La Clemenza di Tito' Premieres
09-06.description: Wolfgang Mozart's dramatic opera 'La Clemenza di Tito' premieres at the Estates Theatre in Prague.

09-07.title: Tupac Shakur Fatally Shot
09-07.description: Rapper Tupac Shakur is shot multiple times in a drive-by shooting in Las Vegas. He dies from his injuries six days later.

09-08.title: Kylie Minogue Releases 'Can't Get You Out of My Head'
09-08.description: Kylie Minogue releases her single 'Can't Get You Out of My Head,' which would become the biggest hit of her career.

09-09.title: John Lennon Releases 'Imagine' Album
09-09.description: John Lennon releases his second solo studio album, 'Imagine,' in the US. It tops the charts in multiple countries.

09-10.title: Nirvana Releases 'Smells Like Teen Spirit'
09-10.description: Rock band Nirvana releases their single 'Smells Like Teen Spirit,' a song often dubbed the anthem of Generation X.

09-11.title: W. C. Handy Publishes 'St. Louis Blues'
09-11.description: W. C. Handy, often called the 'Father of the Blues,' publishes 'St. Louis Blues,' his most famous composition.

09-12.title: Mahler's 'Symphony of a Thousand' Premieres
09-12.description: Gustav Mahler's massive 8th Symphony, known as the 'Symphony of a Thousand,' premieres in Munich with over 1,000 performers.

09-13.title: The Beatles Release 'Yesterday'
09-13.description: The Beatles release the single 'Yesterday.' The recording features only Paul McCartney on acoustic guitar, accompanied by a string quartet arranged by George Martin.

09-14.title: Handel Finishes 'Messiah' Oratorio
09-14.description: George Frideric Handel finishes his famous 'Messiah' oratorio after working on it nonstop for just 24 days.

09-15.title: Mary J. Blige Releases 'Be Without You'
09-15.description: 'Be Without You,' a single by Mary J. Blige, is released. It was named Billboard's R&B/Hip-Hop Song of the Year for 2006.

09-16.title: Metropolitan Opera House Opens at Lincoln Center
09-16.description: The new Metropolitan Opera House opens at Lincoln Center in New York City, with a performance of Samuel Barber's 'Antony and Cleopatra'.

09-17.title: The Beatles Paid Record Fee for Kansas City Concert
09-17.description: The Beatles are paid a record $150,000 for a single concert at Municipal Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, on what was supposed to be a day off.

09-18.title: Royal Opera House Opens in London
09-18.description: The Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, London, opens its doors for the first time.

09-19.title: Chubby Checker's 'The Twist' Sparks Dance Craze
09-19.description: Chubby Checker's cover version of 'The Twist' hits #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, sparking a worldwide dance craze.

09-20.title: The Archies' 'Sugar, Sugar' Hits #1
09-20.description: The single 'Sugar, Sugar' by The Archies, a virtual cartoon band, hits #1 on the Billboard Hot 100.

09-21.title: Green Day Releases 'American Idiot'
09-21.description: Green Day releases their critically acclaimed rock opera album, 'American Idiot,' in the US.

09-22.title: Wagner's 'Das Rheingold' Premieres
09-22.description: Richard Wagner's opera 'Das Rheingold,' the first part of his monumental 'Ring' cycle, premieres in Munich, Germany.

09-23.title: Buddy Holly's 'That'll Be the Day' Reaches #1
09-23.description: The single 'That'll Be the Day' by Buddy Holly and The Crickets reaches #1 in the US.

09-24.title: Elvis Presley Releases 'Jailhouse Rock'
09-24.description: The single 'Jailhouse Rock' is released by Elvis Presley. It was named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1957.

09-25.title: The Band U2 is Formed
09-25.description: The members of the future rock band U2—Bono, The Edge, his brother Dik, and Adam Clayton—respond to an ad posted by Larry Mullen Jr. to form a band.

09-26.title: The Beatles Release 'Abbey Road'
09-26.description: The Beatles release their 11th studio album, 'Abbey Road,' the final album they recorded together as a quartet.

09-27.title: W. C. Handy Publishes 'Memphis Blues'
09-27.description: W. C. Handy publishes 'Memphis Blues,' considered one of the first commercially successful blues songs.

09-28.title: The Beatles' 'Hey Jude' Stays at #1
09-28.description: The Beatles' single 'Hey Jude' hits #1 on the charts and stays there for nine weeks.

09-29.title: Prince's 'Let's Go Crazy' Reaches #1
09-29.description: 'Let's Go Crazy' by Prince and The Revolution, the second single from the 'Purple Rain' album, peaks at #1.

09-30.title: Mozart's 'The Magic Flute' Premieres
09-30.description: Mozart's opera 'The Magic Flute' premieres in Vienna, Austria, just two months before the composer's death.

10-01.title: Marvin Gaye Releases 'Midnight Love'
10-01.description: Marvin Gaye releases his final studio album, 'Midnight Love,' which features the iconic comeback single 'Sexual Healing'.

10-02.title: Oasis Releases '(What's the Story) Morning Glory?'
10-02.description: British band Oasis releases their second studio album, '(What's the Story) Morning Glory?,' which sells a record 347,000 copies in its first week in the UK.

10-04.title: John Lennon Releases 'Walls and Bridges'
10-04.description: John Lennon releases his fifth studio album, 'Walls & Bridges,' which features his only solo #1 single during his lifetime, 'Whatever Gets You Thru the Night'.

10-04.title: Pink Floyd's 'Wish You Were Here' Reaches #1
10-04.description: Pink Floyd's concept album 'Wish You Were Here' reaches #1 in the US and goes on to sell 13 million copies.

10-05.title: The Beatles Release First Single 'Love Me Do'
10-05.description: The Beatles release their debut single, 'Love Me Do,' in the United Kingdom.

10-06.title: George Michael Releases 'Faith'
10-06.description: The single 'Faith' is released by George Michael. It would be named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1988.

10-07.title: Musical 'Cats' Opens on Broadway
10-07.description: The musical 'Cats' opens at the Winter Garden Theatre on Broadway in New York City and runs for nearly 18 years, winning seven Tony Awards.

10-08.title: John Lennon Releases 'Imagine' Album in UK
10-08.description: John Lennon's iconic solo album 'Imagine' is released in the UK, topping the charts.

10-09.title: 'The Phantom of the Opera' Premieres in London
10-09.description: The stage musical 'The Phantom of the Opera,' written by Andrew Lloyd Webber, premieres in London and runs for over 13,000 performances.

10-10.title: 'Jesus Christ Superstar' Soundtrack Recorded
10-10.description: The original concept soundtrack album for Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's rock opera 'Jesus Christ Superstar' is recorded.

10-11.title: Lionel Richie Releases 'Can't Slow Down'
10-11.description: 'Can't Slow Down,' the second studio album by Lionel Richie, is released, featuring hits like 'All Night Long' and 'Hello'.

10-12.title: George Harrison Releases 'Got My Mind Set On You'
10-12.description: George Harrison releases the single 'Got My Mind Set On You.' It became his third solo #1 hit and the last chart-topper by any former Beatle.

10-13.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience Debuts
10-13.description: The rock trio The Jimi Hendrix Experience, featuring American guitarist Jimi Hendrix, British bassist Noel Redding, and British drummer Mitch Mitchell, makes its live debut in France.

10-13.title: Bob Dylan Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
10-13.description: American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan is named the recipient of the Nobel Prize in Literature for 'having created new poetic expressions within the great American song tradition'.

10-15.title: Debby Boone's 'You Light Up My Life' Hits #1
10-15.description: Debby Boone's single 'You Light Up My Life' goes to #1 and stays there for ten weeks, setting a new record at the time.

10-16.title: Schoenberg's 'Pierrot Lunaire' Premieres
10-16.description: Arnold Schoenberg's influential melodrama 'Pierrot Lunaire' premieres in Berlin.

10-17.title: The Beatles Record 'I Want to Hold Your Hand'
10-17.description: The Beatles record 'I Want to Hold Your Hand' at EMI Studios in London, the song that would launch their career in the United States.

10-18.title: Aaron Copland's Third Symphony Premieres
10-18.description: The first performance of Aaron Copland's Third Symphony, often called the 'Great American Symphony,' is given by the Boston Symphony Orchestra.

10-19.title: Cher Releases 'Believe'
10-19.description: Cher releases the single 'Believe.' It was named Billboard's Song of the Year for 1999 and won a Grammy for Best Dance Recording.

10-20.title: Sydney Opera House Opens
10-20.description: Queen Elizabeth II officially opens the Sydney Opera House in Sydney, Australia, after 14 years of construction.

10-21.title: Offenbach's 'Orpheus in the Underworld' Premieres
10-21.description: Jacques Offenbach's operetta 'Orpheus in the Underworld' premieres in Paris, featuring the famous 'Infernal Galop' (the can-can tune).

10-22.title: Original Metropolitan Opera House Opens
10-22.description: New York's original Metropolitan Opera House has its grand opening with a performance of Charles Gounod's opera 'Faust'.

10-23.title: Adele Releases 'Hello'
10-23.description: Adele releases her single 'Hello,' which becomes the first song to sell more than a million digital copies in its first week.

10-24.title: Paul McCartney Recognized as Best-Selling Songwriter
10-24.description: The Guinness Book of World Records presents Paul McCartney with a rhodium disc as the all-time best-selling singer-songwriter.

10-25.title: Tchaikovsky's Piano Concerto No. 1 Premieres
10-25.description: The first performance of the Piano Concerto No. 1 by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky is given in Boston, Massachusetts.

10-26.title: Elgar's Cello Concerto Premieres
10-26.description: Edward Elgar's Cello Concerto in E minor, his last notable work, premieres at Queen's Hall in London.

10-27.title: Ben E. King Records 'Stand By Me'
10-27.description: American soul singer Ben E. King records the timeless classics 'Spanish Harlem' and 'Stand By Me' in New York City.

10-28.title: Pulitzer-Winning Musical 'Fiorello!' Closes
10-28.description: The musical 'Fiorello!,' starring Tom Bosley, closes on Broadway after 796 performances and winning a Pulitzer Prize for Drama.

10-29.title: Mozart's Opera 'Don Giovanni' Premieres
10-29.description: The opera 'Don Giovanni,' with music by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, premieres at the Estates Theatre in Prague.

10-30.title: Aaron Copland's 'Appalachian Spring' Premieres
10-30.description: Aaron Copland's ballet score 'Appalachian Spring' premieres at the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C., with Martha Graham dancing the lead role.

10-31.title: Barbra Streisand's 'People' Album Hits #1
10-31.description: Barbra Streisand's album 'People' hits #1 on the charts, where it stays for five weeks.

11-01.title: The Beatles' 'Abbey Road' Hits #1 in U.S.
11-01.description: The Beatles' album 'Abbey Road' goes to #1 in the US and stays there for 11 weeks.

11-02.title: Michael Jackson Releases 'Thriller' Single
11-02.description: The iconic single 'Thriller' is released worldwide by Michael Jackson.

11-03.title: Whitney Houston Releases 'I Will Always Love You'
11-03.description: Whitney Houston releases her cover of Dolly Parton's 'I Will Always Love You.' The song became Billboard's Song of the Year for 1993 and one of the best-selling singles of all time.

11-04.title: Brahms' 1st Symphony Premieres
11-04.description: Johannes Brahms' Symphony No. 1 in C minor premieres in Karlsruhe, Germany.

11-05.title: Vienna State Opera Reopens
11-05.description: The rebuilt Vienna State Opera reopens with a performance of Beethoven's 'Fidelio,' after having been destroyed during World War II.

11-06.title: First Performance by the Sex Pistols
11-06.description: The punk rock band the Sex Pistols gives its first public performance at St. Martin's College in London.

11-07.title: Oldest U.S. Musical Organization Founded
11-07.description: The oldest continuously performing musical organization in the United States, the Stoughton Musical Society, is founded in Stoughton, Massachusetts.

11-08.title: Gershwin Musical 'Oh, Kay!' Opens
11-08.description: The musical 'Oh, Kay!,' with music by George and Ira Gershwin, opens at the Imperial Theatre in NYC.

11-08.title: Andrea Bocelli Releases Best-Selling Classical Album
11-08.description: Tenor Andrea Bocelli releases his 'Sacred Arias' album, which becomes the world's best-selling classical album by a solo artist.

11-09.title: New York Symphony Orchestra's First Performance
11-09.description: The New York Symphony Orchestra gives its first performance. The group would later merge with the New York Philharmonic in 1928.

11-11.title: Louis Armstrong's Hot Five Begins Recording
11-11.description: Louis Armstrong and his influential jazz group, the Hot Five, begin their first recording session at Okeh Records in Chicago.

11-12.title: Musical 'Grand Hotel' Opens on Broadway
11-12.description: The musical 'Grand Hotel: The Musical' opens at the Martin Beck Theatre in NYC, running for over 1,000 performances and winning five Tony Awards.

11-12.title: Britney Spears' Conservatorship Ends
11-12.description: A Los Angeles judge rules to end Britney Spears' conservatorship, which had controlled almost all aspects of her life for nearly 14 years.

11-13.title: Eminem Releases 'Lose Yourself'
11-13.description: Eminem releases the single 'Lose Yourself' from the soundtrack of his film '8 Mile.' It became the first rap song to win the Academy Award for Best Original Song.

11-13.title: Kylie Minogue Sets UK Album Chart Record
11-13.description: Kylie Minogue becomes the first woman to top the UK album chart over five consecutive decades with her album 'Disco'.

11-14.title: Ray Charles' 'Georgia On My Mind' Reaches #1
11-14.description: Ray Charles' iconic single 'Georgia On My Mind' reaches #1 on the Billboard charts.

11-15.title: Beastie Boys Release 'Licensed to Ill'
11-15.description: The Beastie Boys release their debut album 'Licensed to Ill,' which becomes the first rap album to reach #1 on the Billboard charts.

11-16.title: 'The Sound of Music' Opens on Broadway
11-16.description: Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical 'The Sound of Music' opens at the Lunt-Fontanne Theatre in NYC, running for 1,443 performances.

11-17.title: Britney Spears Gets Star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
11-17.description: At 21 years old, Britney Spears becomes the youngest singer at the time to receive a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

11-18.title: One Direction Releases Debut Album 'Up All Night'
11-18.description: The boy band One Direction, formed on 'The X Factor,' releases their debut album 'Up All Night' in Ireland and the UK.

11-19.title: Milli Vanilli Stripped of Grammy Award
11-19.description: The pop duo Milli Vanilli are stripped of their Grammy Award after it is revealed they did not sing on their award-winning album, 'Girl You Know It's True'.

11-20.title: Beethoven's Opera 'Fidelio' Premieres
11-20.description: Ludwig van Beethoven's only opera, 'Fidelio,' premieres at Vienna's Theater an der Wien.

11-21.title: Shostakovich's 5th Symphony Premieres
11-21.description: Dmitri Shostakovich's 5th Symphony premieres in Leningrad to an ovation that reportedly lasted for over an hour.

11-22.title: RCA Records Buys Elvis Presley's Contract
11-22.description: RCA Records makes one of its best investments, paying $35,000 to Sun Records for Elvis Presley's recording contract.

11-23.title: Snoop Dogg Releases Debut Album 'Doggystyle'
11-23.description: 'Doggystyle,' the debut album by Snoop Doggy Dogg, is released and becomes Billboard's Hip-Hop/R&B Album of the Year for 1994.

11-24.title: Musical 'Guys & Dolls' Opens on Broadway
11-24.description: Frank Loesser's musical 'Guys & Dolls' opens on Broadway, running for 1,200 performances and winning five Tony Awards.

11-25.title: Disney Releases 'Frozen' Soundtrack
11-25.description: Disney releases the 'Frozen: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack.' It won a Grammy and was named Billboard's Album of the Year for 2014.

11-26.title: Charlie Parker's 'Greatest Jazz Session Ever'
11-26.description: Charlie 'Bird' Parker leads a recording session with Dizzy Gillespie and Miles Davis for the Savoy label, which was later marketed as the 'greatest jazz session ever'.

11-27.title: The Beatles Release 'Magical Mystery Tour'
11-27.description: The Beatles release their album 'Magical Mystery Tour' in the US. It was issued as a double EP in the UK.

11-28.title: Grand Ole Opry Premieres
11-28.description: The Grand Ole Opry premieres as the WSM Barn Dance on WSM Radio in Nashville, Tennessee, becoming an American institution.

11-29.title: Michael Jackson Releases 'Thriller'
11-29.description: 'Thriller,' the sixth studio album by Michael Jackson, is released. It won a Grammy for Album of the Year and is the best-selling album of all time.

11-29.title: Mary J. Blige Releases 'My Life'
11-29.description: Mary J. Blige releases her second studio album, 'My Life,' which won the Billboard Music Award for Top R&B Album in 1995.

11-29.title: Taylor Swift Named Spotify's Most-Streamed Artist
11-29.description: Taylor Swift is named Spotify's most-streamed global artist of the year with 26.1 billion streams, while 'Flowers' by Miley Cyrus is the most-streamed song.

11-30.title: Pink Floyd Releases 'The Wall'
11-30.description: Pink Floyd's iconic rock opera album 'The Wall' is released, selling six million copies in just two weeks.

11-30.title: The Beatles Release 'Live at the BBC'
11-30.description: The Beatles release 'Live at the BBC' in Britain, their first album of new material in over 20 years.

12-01.title: Franz Liszt Makes Pianist Debut at Age 11
12-01.description: A young Franz Liszt, aged 11, makes his debut as a concert pianist in Vienna, beginning a legendary career.

12-02.title: Brahms' 'Symphony No. 3' Premieres
12-02.description: Johannes Brahms' 'Symphony No. 3 in F major' premieres with the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra.

12-03.title: Elgar's Symphony No. 1 Premieres
12-03.description: Edward Elgar's Symphony No. 1 in A-flat major premieres in Manchester, England.

12-03.title: Drake Named Spotify's Most-Streamed Artist of the Decade
12-03.description: Spotify announces Drake as the most-streamed artist of the 2010s with 28 billion streams, while Ed Sheeran's 'Shape of You' is the most-streamed track.

12-04.title: Duke Ellington Opens at the Cotton Club
12-04.description: Duke Ellington and his orchestra begin their legendary residency at the Cotton Club in Harlem, New York City.

12-05.title: Paul McCartney & Wings Release 'Band on the Run'
12-05.description: Paul McCartney and Wings release the album 'Band on the Run' in the US, a commercial and critical high point of his post-Beatles career.

12-06.title: Altamont Free Concert
12-06.description: An estimated 300,000 people attend a free concert headlined by The Rolling Stones in Altamont, California. The event is marred by violence and four deaths.

12-07.title: The Grateful Dead Disband
12-07.description: The surviving members of the American rock band The Grateful Dead announce their breakup following the death of guitarist and frontman Jerry Garcia.

12-08.title: Beethoven's 7th Symphony Premieres
12-08.description: Ludwig van Beethoven's 7th Symphony in A major premieres in Vienna, with Beethoven himself conducting.

12-09.title: John Coltrane Quartet Records 'A Love Supreme'
12-09.description: John Coltrane's Quartet records its masterpiece album, 'A Love Supreme,' at Van Gelder Studio in New Jersey.

12-10.title: Bob Dylan Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
12-10.description: Bob Dylan is officially awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony in Stockholm, Sweden, though he does not attend to accept it in person.

12-11.title: Hank Williams Begins Recording Career
12-11.description: Country music pioneer Hank Williams begins his recording career for the Sterling Records label.

12-12.title: Beethoven Takes First Lesson from Haydn
12-12.description: In Vienna, a 22-year-old Ludwig van Beethoven receives his first lesson in music composition from the 60-year-old master, Franz Joseph Haydn.

12-13.title: First Music Store in America Opens
12-13.description: The first dedicated music store in America is opened in Philadelphia by Michael Hillegas, who would later become the first Treasurer of the United States.

12-14.title: First U.S. Chamber Music Group Gives Concert
12-14.description: The first documented chamber music group in the US gives its first concert in Boston, Massachusetts.

12-15.title: Johnny Cash Releases 'Folsom Prison Blues'
12-15.description: The single 'Folsom Prison Blues' is released by Johnny Cash. A live version would become Billboard's Country Song of the Year in 1968.

12-16.title: Dvořák's 'New World Symphony' Premieres
12-16.description: Antonín Dvořák's Symphony No. 9, 'From the New World,' premieres at Carnegie Hall in New York City.

12-17.title: Schubert's 'Unfinished Symphony' Premieres
12-17.description: Franz Schubert's Symphony No. 8, famously known as the 'Unfinished Symphony,' premieres in Vienna decades after his death.

12-18.title: Tchaikovsky's 'The Nutcracker' Premieres
12-18.description: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky's ballet 'The Nutcracker' premieres in Saint Petersburg, Russia, and is now the world's most performed ballet.

12-19.title: Frank Sinatra's First Reprise Records Session
12-19.description: Frank Sinatra holds his first recording session for his own label, Reprise Records, recording 'Ring-a-Ding-Ding' and 'Let's Fall in Love'.

12-20.title: Schubert's 'Rosamunde' Music Premieres
12-20.description: The play 'Rosamunde, Princess of Cyprus,' featuring incidental music composed by Franz Schubert, premieres in Vienna.

12-21.title: Glen Campbell's 'Wichita Lineman' Reaches #1
12-21.description: Glen Campbell's classic album 'Wichita Lineman' reaches #1 on the US charts.

12-22.title: Debussy's 'Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun' Premieres
12-22.description: Claude Debussy's first orchestral masterpiece, 'Prélude à l'après-midi d'un faune' (Prelude to the Afternoon of a Faun), premieres in Paris.

12-23.title: Opera 'Hansel and Gretel' Premieres
12-23.description: The opera 'Hansel and Gretel' by Engelbert Humperdinck premieres in Weimar, conducted by Richard Strauss.

12-24.title: Verdi's Opera 'Aida' Premieres
12-24.description: Giuseppe Verdi's grand opera 'Aida' premieres in Cairo, Egypt, to celebrate the opening of the Khedivial Opera House.

12-25.title: John Philip Sousa Composes 'The Stars and Stripes Forever'
12-25.description: The patriotic march 'The Stars and Stripes Forever' is composed by John Philip Sousa, who was inspired while on a ship returning to America.

12-26.title: Jimi Hendrix Writes 'Purple Haze'
12-26.description: Jimi Hendrix writes the lyrics for his iconic song 'Purple Haze' on a napkin backstage at the Upper Cut Club in London.

12-27.title: Radio City Music Hall Opens
12-27.description: Radio City Music Hall opens at Rockefeller Center in Manhattan, New York City, becoming an iconic entertainment venue.

12-28.title: Leonard Bernstein's 'On the Town' Opens
12-28.description: The musical 'On the Town,' with music by Leonard Bernstein, opens on Broadway and runs for 462 performances.

12-29.title: Scott Joplin Copyrights 'The Entertainer'
12-29.description: Scott Joplin copyrights 'The Entertainer' and several other of his famous piano rag compositions with the U.S. Copyright Office.

12-30.title: Frank Sinatra Records 'My Way'
12-30.description: Frank Sinatra records his signature song, 'My Way,' for the first time. The lyrics were written for him by Paul Anka.

12-31.title: Rod Stewart Holds World's Largest Free Concert
12-31.description: Rod Stewart performs a free New Year's Eve concert for an estimated 3.5 million people at Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, the largest free concert crowd in history.
